{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Data Engineer",
  "description": "NewGlobe supports visionary governments to transform public education systems, the cornerstone of a prosperous, equitable, and peaceful society. With a comprehensive system transformation platform and data-driven educational services, NewGlobe delivers rapid and dramatic improvements in learning outcomes at state and nationwide scale. Through building impactful partnerships and programmes, NewGlobe ensures that all children have access to an education that will develop their full potential and create a foundation for growth and prosperity.

NewGlobe leverages more than a decade of educational experience and proven impact in integrated school management, teacher professional development, instructional design innovation, technological system support, child-centered classroom practice, and parent engagement -&nbsp; all grounded in learning science - to ensure each teacher is empowered to engage children in transformational learning, and all children have the opportunity to develop to their full potential. Every day, NewGlobe supports governments to solve what were once seen as intractable problems, and by doing so, ensures this generation will be able to grow up to lead more fulfilled lives, while simultaneously building economic prosperity for themselves, their communities, and the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Data Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Role


	NewGlobe has been data-driven from its inception, using a build-measure-learn approach to all aspects of service delivery.
	As a scale model business, we have an unprecedented opportunity to bring statistical power to all aspects of an educational operation, from the academics team using randomized controlled trials to validate the best teaching methods to the schools team understanding which factors contribute to teacher turnover to operational teams striving to improve our service delivery efficiency.
	However, we have reached an inflection point where we need to take our data game to the next level. Instead of just providing data to our various departments, we need to start bringing to bear more sophisticated techniques to unlock the potential of our significant data sets.
	While we collect tens of thousands of data points every term from each of our academies &ndash; from the time spent on each page of a lesson to the billing and payment history of every pupil &ndash; we are yet to fully realize the potential energy of these data sets.
	We&rsquo;re looking to build our next generation Data Platform team in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, alongside our software and product teams. The role of the Data Engineer is at the forefront of that transformation, ensuring our data models and data aggregation processes are robust, scalable, and ready for whatever we dream up next.


What You Will Do


	Assist data-product development teams in creating and testing data models for a variety of business-analytics use cases, operational applications, internal monitoring and observability scenarios to fulfill&nbsp; the company goals..
	Recommend solutions to improve new and existing data-engineering systems.
	Take the lead in data-migration tasks from legacy systems.
	Design and implement monitoring solutions&nbsp; for system performances and observability.
	Drive technical innovation and lead on new technology exploration.
	Improve the scalability, stability, accuracy, and efficiency of our existing data systems.
	Contribute to effective data governance practices, including data quality, data management, data policies, business-process management, and risk management surrounding the handling of business data.
	Communicate effectively with business stakeholders and outside actors during feature development&nbsp; and planning of new requirements for our data platform.


What You Should Have


	4+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering or a similar role.
	Passion for data-product development across a variety of tools and technologies.
	Proven experience with modern data-ingestion (Fivetran, Airbyte, etc.) and data-orchestration (Airflow, Dagster, etc.) systems.
	Deep understanding of data processing and transformation practices and tools (data frames, SQL, DBT, etc.).
	Familiarity with Microsoft technologies, especially Microsoft SQL Server, (current operational systems).
	Deep understanding of, and experience with, popular data-engineering systems like Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka, etc., and ability&nbsp; to advocate for their appropriate adoption at NewGlobe (pros and cons analysis, PoC, etc.).
	Fluency with data-warehouse design and dimensional modelling (star schemas, snowflakes, etc).
	Understanding of NoSQL databases and unstructured data.
	Experience with version control, continuous delivery/integration, and test driven development.
	Experience or interest in results-driven, lean/agile environments.
	Ability to prioritize and execute tasks in a fast paced environment.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-27",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-28",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "NewGlobe"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189432"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Senior Data Engineer Job at NewGlobe




        
    

        
        NewGlobe supports visionary governments to transform public education systems, the cornerstone of a prosperous, equitable, and peaceful society. With a comprehensive system transformation platform and data-driven educational services, NewGlobe delivers rapid and dramatic improvements in learning outcomes at state and nationwide scale. Through building impactful partnerships and programmes, NewGlobe ensures that all children have access to an education that will develop their full potential and create a foundation for growth and prosperity.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



NewGlobe leverages more than a decade of educational experience and proven impact in integrated school management, teacher professional development, instructional design innovation, technological system support, child-centered classroom practice, and parent engagement -  all grounded in learning science - to ensure each teacher is empowered to engage children in transformational learning, and all children have the opportunity to develop to their full potential. Every day, NewGlobe supports governments to solve what were once seen as intractable problems, and by doing so, ensures this generation will be able to grow up to lead more fulfilled lives, while simultaneously building economic prosperity for themselves, their communities, and the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Data Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

About the Role


	NewGlobe has been data-driven from its inception, using a build-measure-learn approach to all aspects of service delivery.
	As a scale model business, we have an unprecedented opportunity to bring statistical power to all aspects of an educational operation, from the academics team using randomized controlled trials to validate the best teaching methods to the schools team understanding which factors contribute to teacher turnover to operational teams striving to improve our service delivery efficiency.
	However, we have reached an inflection point where we need to take our data game to the next level. Instead of just providing data to our various departments, we need to start bringing to bear more sophisticated techniques to unlock the potential of our significant data sets.
	While we collect tens of thousands of data points every term from each of our academies – from the time spent on each page of a lesson to the billing and payment history of every pupil – we are yet to fully realize the potential energy of these data sets.
	We’re looking to build our next generation Data Platform team in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, alongside our software and product teams. The role of the Data Engineer is at the forefront of that transformation, ensuring our data models and data aggregation processes are robust, scalable, and ready for whatever we dream up next.


What You Will Do


	Assist data-product development teams in creating and testing data models for a variety of business-analytics use cases, operational applications, internal monitoring and observability scenarios to fulfill  the company goals..
	Recommend solutions to improve new and existing data-engineering systems.
	Take the lead in data-migration tasks from legacy systems.
	Design and implement monitoring solutions  for system performances and observability.
	Drive technical innovation and lead on new technology exploration.
	Improve the scalability, stability, accuracy, and efficiency of our existing data systems.
	Contribute to effective data governance practices, including data quality, data management, data policies, business-process management, and risk management surrounding the handling of business data.
	Communicate effectively with business stakeholders and outside actors during feature development  and planning of new requirements for our data platform.


What You Should Have


	4+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering or a similar role.
	Passion for data-product development across a variety of tools and technologies.
	Proven experience with modern data-ingestion (Fivetran, Airbyte, etc.) and data-orchestration (Airflow, Dagster, etc.) systems.
	Deep understanding of data processing and transformation practices and tools (data frames, SQL, DBT, etc.).
	Familiarity with Microsoft technologies, especially Microsoft SQL Server, (current operational systems).
	Deep understanding of, and experience with, popular data-engineering systems like Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka, etc., and ability  to advocate for their appropriate adoption at NewGlobe (pros and cons analysis, PoC, etc.).
	Fluency with data-warehouse design and dimensional modelling (star schemas, snowflakes, etc).
	Understanding of NoSQL databases and unstructured data.
	Experience with version control, continuous delivery/integration, and test driven development.
	Experience or interest in results-driven, lean/agile environments.
	Ability to prioritize and execute tasks in a fast paced environment.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Female Secretary",
  "description": "Fave Consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Secretary
Job Location:&nbsp;Kubwa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a dedicated and efficient Secretary to join our team.
	The ideal candidate must have exceptional typing skills and the ability to type quickly and accurately, as this is a fundamental requirement for the role.
	The ideal candidate will manage front desk activities while maintaining proper documentation and ensuring accurate record-keeping.
	Close proximity within Kubwa and envrions.


Key Responsibilities


	Meeting Support: Taking minutes, preparing agendas, and assisting with meeting.
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, Draft, format, and proofread documents and reports.
	Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence, including emails and phone calls.
	Maintain organized filing systems for easy access to information.
	Support team members with various administrative tasks.
	Handle confidential information with integrity.
	Serve as the first point of contact at the front desk for visitors, clients, and partners
	Maintain and update client records, visitor logs, and office documents with accuracy and confidentiality
	Assist in basic bookkeeping and administrative record-keeping.


Requirements


	He / She must have completed SSCE, OND, HND or B.Sc
	Have at least 2 years of experience in the role.
	Excellent typing speed and accuracy (minimum 50 Words per Min).
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Great communication and interpersonal abilities.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter in PDF to:&nbsp;recruitment@faveconsulting.com&nbsp;using &quot;Secretary Position &quot; as the subject of the email.",

Female Secretary Job at Fave Consulting




        
    

        
        Fave Consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Secretary
Job Location: Kubwa, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a dedicated and efficient Secretary to join our team.
	The ideal candidate must have exceptional typing skills and the ability to type quickly and accurately, as this is a fundamental requirement for the role.
	The ideal candidate will manage front desk activities while maintaining proper documentation and ensuring accurate record-keeping.
	Close proximity within Kubwa and envrions.


Key Responsibilities


	Meeting Support: Taking minutes, preparing agendas, and assisting with meeting.
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, Draft, format, and proofread documents and reports.
	Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence, including emails and phone calls.
	Maintain organized filing systems for easy access to information.
	Support team members with various administrative tasks.
	Handle confidential information with integrity.
	Serve as the first point of contact at the front desk for visitors, clients, and partners
	Maintain and update client records, visitor logs, and office documents with accuracy and confidentiality
	Assist in basic bookkeeping and administrative record-keeping.


Requirements


	He / She must have completed SSCE, OND, HND or B.Sc
	Have at least 2 years of experience in the role.
	Excellent typing speed and accuracy (minimum 50 Words per Min).
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Great communication and interpersonal abilities.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter in PDF to: recruitment@faveconsulting.com using "Secretary Position " as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Control Officer (Rice Production)",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer&nbsp;(Rice Production)

Job Locations:&nbsp;Lagos &amp;&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Quality Control is responsible for ensuring that all rice produced, processed, or packaged meets the company&rsquo;s quality and safety standards before distribution.


Key Duties and Responsibilities


	Inspect rice grains for impurities, discoloration, or broken pieces.
	Check moisture content to ensure rice is properly dried.
	Verify correct packaging, labeling, and sealing of rice bags.
	Record inspection results and report any quality issues to the supervisor.
	Maintain cleanliness and hygiene in the processing area.
	Ensure compliance with company safety and quality control policies.
	Assist in sorting and reworking rejected or substandard batches.
	Travel to different rice mills or distribution points across Nigeria to monitor quality consistency.


Requirements


	At least 1 year of relevant work experience in rice production or food quality checking.
	Strong attention to detail and observation skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Physically fit and able to work in production environments.
	Willingness to travel across Nigeria as required.
	Must have experience majorly in Rice Production.


Salary
N150,000 Gross Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified&nbsp;candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp; cv@ascentech.com.ng&nbsp;using&nbsp; &lsquo;Quality Check &ndash; Lagos / Port Harcourt Bowale&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Quality Control Officer (Rice Production) Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer (Rice Production)

Job Locations: Lagos & Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Quality Control is responsible for ensuring that all rice produced, processed, or packaged meets the company’s quality and safety standards before distribution.


Key Duties and Responsibilities


	Inspect rice grains for impurities, discoloration, or broken pieces.
	Check moisture content to ensure rice is properly dried.
	Verify correct packaging, labeling, and sealing of rice bags.
	Record inspection results and report any quality issues to the supervisor.
	Maintain cleanliness and hygiene in the processing area.
	Ensure compliance with company safety and quality control policies.
	Assist in sorting and reworking rejected or substandard batches.
	Travel to different rice mills or distribution points across Nigeria to monitor quality consistency.


Requirements


	At least 1 year of relevant work experience in rice production or food quality checking.
	Strong attention to detail and observation skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Physically fit and able to work in production environments.
	Willingness to travel across Nigeria as required.
	Must have experience majorly in Rice Production.


Salary
N150,000 Gross Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:  cv@ascentech.com.ng using  ‘Quality Check – Lagos / Port Harcourt Bowale" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Farm Manager",
  "description": "Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Farm Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ado Ekiti, Ekiti

Job Description


	Analyze existing operations, crops, and staff and recommend improvements.
	Prepare plans and schedules for planting and harvesting, and ensure staff understand expectations.
	Ensure farm supervisors and officers are delivering their tasks.
	Visit different divisions to inspect crops and perform tests on the soil.
	Ensure seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, and other supplies are regularly stocked.
	Oversee all stages of crop cultivation, including land preparation, planting, weeding, fertilizing, and harvesting.
	Monitor crop growth and development, identifying and addressing any issues such as pests, diseases, and nutrient deficiencies.
	Implement best practices for crop cultivation, including appropriate spacing, pest and disease control measures, and soil management techniques.
	Manage and utilize farm resources efficiently, including land, water, fertilizers, and equipment.
	Maintain accurate records of farm activities, including planting dates, harvesting yields, and input usage.
	Collect data on crop performance and identify areas for improvement.
	Ensure produce quality by implementing quality control measures throughout the production process.
	Adhere to all farm safety regulations and environmental standards, ensuring a safe and healthy working environment for all farm workers.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Agriculture, Agronomy, or a related field. A Master&#39;s degree is preferred.
	Minimum of 5 - 7 years of experience in farm management, with a proven track record of success in cassava or similar crop production.
	Strong knowledge of modern farming techniques, including sustainable agriculture practices.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Proficiency in relevant software and technology used in farm management.
	Familiarity with the agricultural landscape and regulatory environment in Nigeria.


Additional Information:


	Competitive Compensation.
	5 - day workweek.
	Flextime.
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).
	Wellness Programs
	Employee Training Programs
	Growth and Development
	Mentoring and Counseling.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-27",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-28",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Agbeyewa Farms"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Ekiti",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189429"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Farm Manager Job at Agbeyewa Farms




        
    

        
        Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Farm Manager

Job Location: Ado Ekiti, Ekiti

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Analyze existing operations, crops, and staff and recommend improvements.
	Prepare plans and schedules for planting and harvesting, and ensure staff understand expectations.
	Ensure farm supervisors and officers are delivering their tasks.
	Visit different divisions to inspect crops and perform tests on the soil.
	Ensure seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, and other supplies are regularly stocked.
	Oversee all stages of crop cultivation, including land preparation, planting, weeding, fertilizing, and harvesting.
	Monitor crop growth and development, identifying and addressing any issues such as pests, diseases, and nutrient deficiencies.
	Implement best practices for crop cultivation, including appropriate spacing, pest and disease control measures, and soil management techniques.
	Manage and utilize farm resources efficiently, including land, water, fertilizers, and equipment.
	Maintain accurate records of farm activities, including planting dates, harvesting yields, and input usage.
	Collect data on crop performance and identify areas for improvement.
	Ensure produce quality by implementing quality control measures throughout the production process.
	Adhere to all farm safety regulations and environmental standards, ensuring a safe and healthy working environment for all farm workers.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Agriculture, Agronomy, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
	Minimum of 5 - 7 years of experience in farm management, with a proven track record of success in cassava or similar crop production.
	Strong knowledge of modern farming techniques, including sustainable agriculture practices.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Proficiency in relevant software and technology used in farm management.
	Familiarity with the agricultural landscape and regulatory environment in Nigeria.


Additional Information:


	Competitive Compensation.
	5 - day workweek.
	Flextime.
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).
	Wellness Programs
	Employee Training Programs
	Growth and Development
	Mentoring and Counseling.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Office Executive / Receptionist",
  "description": "Uleval Technology - Our client, a&nbsp;prestigious 5-Star Luxury Hotel in Lagos is expanding its operations and invites qualified, passionate, and service-oriented professionals to join their world-class hospitality team in the capacity below:

Job Position: Front Office Executive / Receptionist

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Serve as the face of the hotel, managing guest check-ins, reservations, and front desk operations while ensuring an exceptional guest experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and welcome guests with warmth and professionalism.
	Handle reservations, check-ins, and check-outs efficiently.
	Manage calls, emails, and guest inquiries.
	Coordinate with housekeeping and other departments to ensure guest satisfaction.
	Maintain accurate guest records and billing.


Education / Experience


	B.Sc / HND in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of front desk or guest relations experience in a 4- or 5-star hotel.


General Requirements:


	Strong customer service orientation.
	Excellent grooming and personal presentation.
	Ability to work flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.
	Commitment to maintaining 5-star hospitality standards.


Requirements / Skills:


	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and multitasking skills.
	Proficiency in hotel management software (e.g., Opera, Fidelio).
	Strong grooming and customer relations etiquette.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter (indicating the position applied for) alongside a copy of their photogragh (this is very important)&nbsp;to:&nbsp;jobs@uleval.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;Living in proximity close to Ikoyi, Victoria Island, Lekki is also an advantage.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-27",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Uleval Technology"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

Front Office Executive / Receptionist Job at Uleval Technology




        
    

        
        Uleval Technology - Our client, a prestigious 5-Star Luxury Hotel in Lagos is expanding its operations and invites qualified, passionate, and service-oriented professionals to join their world-class hospitality team in the capacity below:

Job Position: Front Office Executive / Receptionist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Serve as the face of the hotel, managing guest check-ins, reservations, and front desk operations while ensuring an exceptional guest experience.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Greet and welcome guests with warmth and professionalism.
	Handle reservations, check-ins, and check-outs efficiently.
	Manage calls, emails, and guest inquiries.
	Coordinate with housekeeping and other departments to ensure guest satisfaction.
	Maintain accurate guest records and billing.


Education / Experience


	B.Sc / HND in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	2–4 years of front desk or guest relations experience in a 4- or 5-star hotel.


General Requirements:


	Strong customer service orientation.
	Excellent grooming and personal presentation.
	Ability to work flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.
	Commitment to maintaining 5-star hospitality standards.


Requirements / Skills:


	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and multitasking skills.
	Proficiency in hotel management software (e.g., Opera, Fidelio).
	Strong grooming and customer relations etiquette.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter (indicating the position applied for) alongside a copy of their photogragh (this is very important) to: jobs@uleval.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Living in proximity close to Ikoyi, Victoria Island, Lekki is also an advantage.
